title: Troy, Huntingdon volleyball win matches
text:
Troy, Huntingdon volleyball win matches Staff report 11:55 p.m. CDT October 13, 2015 Record crowd came out Tuesday night to watch Troy take on Florida A&M. (Photo: Chris Davis/Troy Athletics) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
TROY – Troy won its sixth straight match, and did so in front of a Troy record crowd of 2,021 fans, beating Florida A&M, 3-2 (25-17, 24-26, 22-25, 25-17, 15-10), at Trojan Arena on Tuesday night. 
Troy (11-11) ended its season-long six-match homestand with a perfect record and also tied the program’s Division I era record with a sixth straight home win. 
“The crowd was amazing,” Troy head coach Sonny Kirkpatrick said. “I think we set a record for attendance and we can’t thank our fans enough. It was an amazing atmosphere, and to pull out a win in front of them makes me feel really good about our team.” 
Ali Dowdall led all players with 23 digs while Alisha Hinrichs posted her first career double-double with 23 assists and 10 digs. Hinrichs was the Trojans’ primary setter for the first two sets, then gave way to Reina Terry who finished with 26 assists in the final three sets. 
Pamela Soriano led Florida A&M with 17 kills, but also had 10 errors and hit just .152. Valeria Lopez posted a match-high 47 assists for the Lady Rattlers. 
The Trojans return to the court and to Sun Belt play this weekend when they travel to take on ULM and UL Lafayette on Friday and Saturday, respectively. Troy just defeated both the Warhawks and Ragin’ Cajuns last weekend at home. 
Hawks get 3-0 win over Piedmont 
Huntingdon picked up its first USA South Athletic Conference win of the season with a 3-0 win over Piedmont College on Tuesday night. 
The 25-19, 25-23 and 25-20 win snapped a 28-match conference losing streak for the Hawks and a 10-match losing streak to Piedmont. This was the first win over the Lions since 2010. 
“I’m extremely proud of our girls,” Huntingdon head coach Latonia Allen said. “They wanted it so badly tonight. We have come so close in matches this season, losing in four games and five games. The girls understand how close we have been to winning those matches and there were just a few little things we needed to fix. 
Junior Kalen Morgan finished with 10 kills and 11 digs for Huntingdon (8-16, 1-8 USA South). Cora Murchison recorded 39 assists and nine digs and Lauren Condon had 17 digs. 
Bria Rochelle led the team with 16 kills and recorded eight digs. Audrianna Hargitt tallied 15 kills. Lexi Rangel added 15 digs while Bobie Wilson had 10 digs. 
Huntingdon steps out of conference play on Thursday to host Pensacola Christian at 6 p.m. in Wilson Gym. Read or Share this story: http://on.mgmadv.com/1LtkRo1 TOP VIDEOS
